page.title: 13CAYTON BUIDINGS OF INTEREST
page.content: The church of St.John the Baptist was built in Cayton in the 12th century and in nearly 800 years there have been 37 vicars. It had a clock fixed in the tower in 1947 as thanksgiving for not having lost any of the men sent to fight in two world wars. The present Methodist Chapel was built in 1903 to replace an old building. The Jubilee Hall was originally the old school built in 1877 and closed in 1972 when the new school was built. It was reopened in 1978 as a community centre. The Village Hall was built in 1969 and is used for many local occasions. The Senior Citizens' Centre has 28 bungalows,with a resident warden,and a hall for social gatherings. Osgodby Community Centre is used by the people of Osgodby. A 17th century cottage still stands.
